  • DataFrame module

DataFrame module¶

The Sloth Dataframe is meant to be a faster version of pandas dataframe. It accomplished this by being a thin wrapper of numpy. Essentially its a numpy matrix with an index and a list of columns corresponding to the the row and columns of the numpy matrix.

Parameters¶

valuesnumpy.ndarray[ndims=2]

Matrix to store in the DataFrame

indexarray-like or Index, optional

Index to use for resulting frame. Defaults to RangeIndex if no index is provided.

columnsarray-like or Index, optional

Column labels to use for resulting frame. Defaults to RangeIndex if no columns are provided.

Sloth.DataFrame.astype()¶
Sloth.DataFrame.fast_init()¶

Backdoor of sorts. Allows for a quicker initialization after slicing.

Parameters:
maskslice

slice to be used

Sloth.DataFrame.from_pandas()¶

Class method to convert pandas dataframe to a sloth frame

Parameters:
dataframepandas.DataFrame

pd.DataFrame to convert into a sloth DataFrame

Returns:
DataFrame

The sloth dataframe

Sloth.DataFrame.iterrows()¶
Sloth.DataFrame.plot()¶

Plotting function. Requires matplotlib and Pandas to be installed. All paramters are passed onto pandas.

Sloth.DataFrame.reindex()¶

Fits the dataframe with a new index.

Parameters:
indexnp.ndarray[ndims=1]

Index to fit the dataframe with.

Returns:
DataFrame

A new DataFrame fitted with the new index

Sloth.DataFrame.rolling()¶
Sloth.DataFrame.to_numpy()¶
Sloth.DataFrame.to_pandas()¶

Class method to convert sloth dataframe to pandas dataframe

Returns:
pandas.DataFrame

The pandas dataframe
